packing_list_date: Extract the packing list date from the header area ("Packing List", "DATE"). If the date is split into day/month/year, join into one line without normalization. Add the date to packing_list_date.
invoice_no: Find invoice reference by labels "Invoice No", "P.Code or Invoice N", "Commercial Invoice". Keep the number exactly as in the document (including symbols like N and hyphens) and add it to invoice_no.
producer: If a producer is listed ("Producer", "Manufacturer", plant/factory name), extract the full legal name; keep the address on the same line if present. Add to producer.
buyer: If the form has "Buyer", "Customer", "Consignee", extract the full name (and address if present) in one line. Add to buyer. If missing, leave empty.
seller: If the form has "Seller", "Supplier", "Shipper", extract the full name in one line. Add to seller. If missing, leave empty.
veterinary_seal: Look for explicit veterinary seal mentions ("Veterinary seal", "Health seal"). Do not confuse with the linear seal "Seal No". If a veterinary seal number is shown, keep it as-is and add to veterinary_seal; otherwise leave empty.
linear_seal: Extract linear seal number(s) by labels "Seal No", "Seal Number". If multiple values (multiple containers), join with "; ". Add to linear_seal.
country_of_origin: If "Country of origin / Origin" is explicitly shown, extract the country and add to country_of_origin. If no explicit field, leave empty (do not infer).
products: The "products" block is expandable: create product_1, product_2, ... in the order of item lines in the document. For each position fill all available fields. If an attribute is given once for multiple lines (e.g., one Latin species), duplicate it into the relevant product_i. In token_refs include references to the source text/table fragments used.
products[*].name_product: Take the commercial name from the item description ("Product", "Description of goods"), e.g., "FROZEN ATLANTIC SALMON FILLET ...". Join line breaks into one line. Add to products[i].name_product.
products[*].latin_name: If a Latin species name is shown (often in parentheses, e.g., "SALMO SALAR"), extract it and add to products[i].latin_name. If not shown, leave empty.
products[*].size_product: Extract size/grade (e.g., "3-4 LB (1.3-1.8 KG)", "80/120"). Keep the source format and add to products[i].size_product.
products[*].unit_box: If an accounting/pricing or packaging unit is explicitly shown ("Unit", "per carton", "per kg", "CASE", etc.), extract it and add to products[i].unit_box. If not shown, leave empty.
products[*].packages: Extract the number of packages by labels "Cases", "Cartons", "Packages", "No. of packages". If type is shown, keep it in one line (e.g., "1375 CASES"). Add to products[i].packages.
products[*].net_weight: Take net weight ("Net Weight", "NET"). Keep number and unit (e.g., KG) in the original format (dot/comma). Add to products[i].net_weight.
products[*].net_weight_with_glaze: If "Net Weight with Glazing" is shown, extract it separately and add to products[i].net_weight_with_glaze. If absent, leave empty.
products[*].net_weight_with_ice: If "Net Weight with Ice" is shown, extract it and add to products[i].net_weight_with_ice. If absent, leave empty.
products[*].net_weight_with_glaze_and_pa: Extract a value like "Net Weight with Glazing and Primary Packing" (or similar) as a separate value. Add it to products[i].net_weight_with_glaze_and_pack. If absent, leave empty.
products[*].gross_weight: Take gross weight ("Gross Weight", "G.W."). Keep number and unit as in the document. Add to products[i].gross_weight.
products[*].price_per_unit: If the packing list shows a unit price (not always), extract it with currency and original formatting and add to products[i].price_per_unit. If no price, leave empty.
products[*].total_price: If the packing list shows a line total, extract it with currency and format and add to products[i].total_price. If no amount, leave empty (do not compute).
products[*].factory_number: Extract the factory/establishment number (e.g., "Establishment No", "Factory No", plant registration) if shown for the item. Add to products[i].factory_number.
products[*].date_of_production: Extract production date for the item ("Date of production", "Production date"). If multiple dates (range), keep as in the source in one line. Add to products[i].date_of_production.
